channel.title: CVE Feed for NASA -- CFITSIO
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NASA -- CFITSIO

item.title: CVE-2019-1010060|2024-08-05T03:07:18.244Z -- nasa -- cfitsio
item.description: NASA CFITSIO prior to 3.43 is affected by: Buffer Overflow. The impact is: arbitrary code execution. The component is: over 40 source code files were changed. The attack vector is: remote unauthenticated attacker. The fixed version is: 3.43. NOTE: this CVE refers to the issues not covered by CVE-2018-3846, CVE-2018-3847, CVE-2018-3848, and CVE-2018-3849. One example is ftp_status in drvrnet.c mishandling a long string beginning with a '4' character.

item.title: CVE-2018-3847|2024-08-05T04:57:24.001Z -- nasa -- cfitsio
item.description: Multiple exploitable buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in image parsing functionality of the CFITSIO library version 3.42. Specially crafted images parsed via the library, can cause a stack-based buffer overflow overwriting arbitrary data. An attacker can deliver an FIT image to trigger this vulnerability and potentially gain code execution.
